III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10123 Staff sufficiency
Section (1) A facility shall have a staffing pattern of administrative,
Description supervisory, direct care, and other staff sufficient to perform
the prescribed functions required by those administrative
rules and to provide for the needs, protection, and
supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A is being bullied and threatened. He has been threatened
with glass and spit on. There is violence in the facility.
1

Investigation Interviews:
All interviews were completed on 6/25/25 at the facility.
Administrator 1 reported she does not have knowledge of Youth
A being bullied by anyone. Administrator 1 reported it would be
“shocking” if Youth A was found to be bullied. Administrator 1
reported if there was bullying behavior, the group would be
redirected verbally, then a “group attention”, then consequences.
If those interventions didn’t work, it would lead to a behavior
management (restraint/seclusion) depending on the circumstance.
Administrator 2 reported he had not heard Youth A being bullied
by anyone. Administrator 2 reported Youth A has not been
threatened with glass, nor has he been spit on.
Both Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 did not report
violence in the agency.
Youth A reported he is not bullied by anyone in the facility. Youth
A reported no one has ever threatened him with glass or spit on
him. Youth A reported he does not feel like there is a lot of
violence in the facility. Youth A reported there are not a lot of
restraints or youth hurting anyone.
Youth B and Youth C are both in the same pod as Youth A. Both
reported they have never seen Youth A bullied by anyone. Both
reported they have never seen anyone threaten Youth A with
glass or spit on him. Both reported there is not a lot of violence in
the facility. Youth B additionally reported there are not too many
fights. Staff have the youth go into their room if they escalate.
Youth C additionally reported she has seen two youth fighting in
two months.
Supervisor 1 supervises the pod Youth A resides in. Supervisor 1
reported she has never seen Youth A bullied, threatened with
glass, or spit on. Supervisor 1 reported there are very minimal
fights between youth or violence. Supervisor 1 reported the staff
redirect, call group attentions, and use the behavior management
rooms well.
Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. All those interviewed,
including Youth A, reported he is not getting bullied in any
manner. All reported there is not “violence” in the agency.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
2

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
